p: Natural products of plant origin are increasingly used in different industries, including cosmetics, pharmaceuticals, and food. In recent decades, interest has increased in knowing the chemical composition and biological activities of these products since many of the compounds present are involved in protecting human health. For example, phenolic compounds play a vital role in the neutralization and inhibition of free radicals [ 1]. These compounds also show a broad spectrum of pharmacological properties such as antimicrobial, anti-inflammatory, anticholinesterase, and cardioprotective activities, among others [ 2, 3]. Today, many aromatic and medicinal plants have become attractive to scientists as natural sources of bioactive phytocomplexes and compounds that could be safer than the synthetic compounds used in the industry.
